block.p: The F.B.I. appealed for help today in locating a possible witness to the deadly derailment of an Amtrak passenger train in a remote desert area.

A passenger and an Amtrak employee reported seeing someone about 300 feet away after the train derailed on Monday, said David Tubbs, an agent with the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The witnesses said the person wore a cowboy hat and could have been male or female, Mr. Tubbs said.
The F.B.I. appealed for help today in locating a possible witness to the deadly derailment of an Amtrak passenger train in a remote desert area.

A passenger and an Amtrak employee reported seeing someone about 300 feet away after the train derailed on Monday, said David Tubbs, an agent with the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The witnesses said the person wore a cowboy hat and could have been male or female, Mr. Tubbs said.
The derailment of the Sunset Limited, 55 miles southwest of here, killed 1 person and injured 70.
